assemblyItem.externalId.description: Select the Assembly you need to build.After an item is selected, the assembly components are displayed on the Items subtab.This field cannot be changed after an assembly build is associated with this work order.
assemblyItem.externalId.name: assemblyItem.externalId

assemblyItem.internalId.description: Select the Assembly you need to build.After an item is selected, the assembly components are displayed on the Items subtab.This field cannot be changed after an assembly build is associated with this work order.
assemblyItem.internalId.name: assemblyItem.internalId

assemblyItem.name.description: Select the Assembly you need to build.After an item is selected, the assembly components are displayed on the Items subtab.This field cannot be changed after an assembly build is associated with this work order.
assemblyItem.name.name: assemblyItem.name

autoCalculateLag.description: Check the Auto-Calculate Lag box to automatically calculate the optimal lag amount, which is the shortest possible lead time for each work order.
autoCalculateLag.name: autoCalculateLag

billOfMaterials.externalId.description: Select the Bill of Materials (BOM) you want to associate with this assembly.
billOfMaterials.externalId.name: billOfMaterials.externalId

billOfMaterials.internalId.description: Select the Bill of Materials (BOM) you want to associate with this assembly.
billOfMaterials.internalId.name: billOfMaterials.internalId

billOfMaterials.name.description: Select the Bill of Materials (BOM) you want to associate with this assembly.
billOfMaterials.name.name: billOfMaterials.name

billOfMaterialsRevision.externalId.description: Select a Bill of Materials Revision to associate with this work order.A BOM Revision displays BOM updates and details throughout the product lifecycle.
billOfMaterialsRevision.externalId.displayName: Bill of Materials Revision - External id
billOfMaterialsRevision.externalId.name: billOfMaterialsRevision.externalId

billOfMaterialsRevision.internalId.description: Select a Bill of Materials Revision to associate with this work order.A BOM Revision displays BOM updates and details throughout the product lifecycle.
billOfMaterialsRevision.internalId.displayName: Bill of Materials Revision - Internal id
billOfMaterialsRevision.internalId.name: billOfMaterialsRevision.internalId

billOfMaterialsRevision.name.description: Select a Bill of Materials Revision to associate with this work order.A BOM Revision displays BOM updates and details throughout the product lifecycle.
billOfMaterialsRevision.name.name: billOfMaterialsRevision.name

built.description: The Built field displays the total number of assemblies that have been completed on associated assembly builds.
built.name: built

createdFrom.externalId.description: The Created From field displays the number of the sales order associated with this work order, if any.Note: The Created From field is not available if you are creating a stand-alone work order on the Enter Work Orders page. The Created From field appears only on existing work orders created from sales orders using one of these methods:    * By clicking on the Work Ord. link on the line item in the sales order    * By automatic work order creation from a sales order when the Create WO field is marked upon saving the sales order
createdFrom.externalId.name: createdFrom.externalId

createdFrom.internalId.description: The Created From field displays the number of the sales order associated with this work order, if any.Note: The Created From field is not available if you are creating a stand-alone work order on the Enter Work Orders page. The Created From field appears only on existing work orders created from sales orders using one of these methods:    * By clicking on the Work Ord. link on the line item in the sales order    * By automatic work order creation from a sales order when the Create WO field is marked upon saving the sales order
createdFrom.internalId.name: createdFrom.internalId

createdFrom.name.description: The Created From field displays the number of the sales order associated with this work order, if any.Note: The Created From field is not available if you are creating a stand-alone work order on the Enter Work Orders page. The Created From field appears only on existing work orders created from sales orders using one of these methods:    * By clicking on the Work Ord. link on the line item in the sales order    * By automatic work order creation from a sales order when the Create WO field is marked upon saving the sales order
createdFrom.name.name: createdFrom.name

customForm.externalId.description: In the Custom Form list, select the form to use with this work order.
customForm.externalId.name: customForm.externalId

customForm.internalId.description: In the Custom Form list, select the form to use with this work order.
customForm.internalId.name: customForm.internalId

customForm.name.description: In the Custom Form list, select the form to use with this work order.
customForm.name.name: customForm.name

department.externalId.description: Select a Department to associate with the assemblies on this work order.This selection is carried over to the assembly build.Click New to enter a new department.
department.externalId.name: department.externalId

department.internalId.description: Select a Department to associate with the assemblies on this work order.This selection is carried over to the assembly build.Click New to enter a new department.
department.internalId.name: department.internalId

department.name.description: Select a Department to associate with the assemblies on this work order.This selection is carried over to the assembly build.Click New to enter a new department.
department.name.name: department.name

endDate.description: In the Production End Date field, enter the date you expect to complete assembly production.This field defaults to show the transaction date plus lead time.
endDate.name: endDate

entity.externalId.description: Select a Customer to associate with this work order.
entity.externalId.name: entity.externalId

entity.internalId.description: Select a Customer to associate with this work order.
entity.internalId.name: entity.internalId

entity.name.description: Select a Customer to associate with this work order.
entity.name.name: entity.name

expandAssembly.description: Check the Mark Sub-Assemblies Phantom box to build member items that are also assemblies used to complete the work order.Sub-assembly components are displayed on the Items subtab.To learn more, see Work Orders and Sub-Assemblies
expandAssembly.name: expandAssembly

firmed.description: Check the Firmed box to save the the order and process it when the supply planning engine runs.
firmed.name: firmed

isWip.description: Check the WIP box to designate the work order to use WIP instead of a standard assembly build.This option is only available when the order status is Released.It cannot be changed once a posting assembly transaction is logged against the work order.To learn more, see Using WIP on Work Orders.
isWip.name: isWip

job.externalId.description: Select a job if the assemblies on this work order are for a particular job. Click the Open icon to open a list of jobs.
job.externalId.name: job.externalId

job.internalId.description: Select a job if the assemblies on this work order are for a particular job. Click the Open icon to open a list of jobs.
job.internalId.name: job.internalId

job.name.description: Select a job if the assemblies on this work order are for a particular job. Click the Open icon to open a list of jobs.
job.name.name: job.name

location.externalId.description: Select a Location to display only work orders for that location.Select All to display work orders for all locations.If you use Multi-Location Inventory, the selected location is the one that component inventory items are committed from.
location.externalId.name: location.externalId

location.internalId.description: Select a Location to display only work orders for that location.Select All to display work orders for all locations.If you use Multi-Location Inventory, the selected location is the one that component inventory items are committed from.
location.internalId.name: location.internalId

location.name.description: Select a Location to display only work orders for that location.Select All to display work orders for all locations.If you use Multi-Location Inventory, the selected location is the one that component inventory items are committed from.
location.name.name: location.name

manufacturingRouting.externalId.description: Select the a Manufacturing Routing.After you select an assembly, NetSuite display the default routing for the assembly based on the location setting.To select an alternate routing, the Manufacturing Routing field displays all routings associated with the assembly for the selected location.
manufacturingRouting.externalId.name: manufacturingRouting.externalId

manufacturingRouting.internalId.description: Select the a Manufacturing Routing.After you select an assembly, NetSuite display the default routing for the assembly based on the location setting.To select an alternate routing, the Manufacturing Routing field displays all routings associated with the assembly for the selected location.
manufacturingRouting.internalId.name: manufacturingRouting.internalId

manufacturingRouting.name.description: Select the a Manufacturing Routing.After you select an assembly, NetSuite display the default routing for the assembly based on the location setting.To select an alternate routing, the Manufacturing Routing field displays all routings associated with the assembly for the selected location.
manufacturingRouting.name.name: manufacturingRouting.name

memo.description: Optionally, enter a Memo for this work order.You can search for the memo text to find this work order.
memo.name: memo

orderStatus.value.description: Select the work order Status.For example, In-Process or Built.
orderStatus.value.name: orderStatus.value

quantity.description: Enter the Quantity of assembly items you want to create.This can be a fractional number.
quantity.name: quantity

revision.externalId.description: For work orders, NetSuite automatically populates the effective revision based on the effective date. If you change the revision selected on the work order, then NetSuite changes the components on the top level assembly based on the revision selected.If you change the revision selected on the work order and the Build Subassembly box is checked, then top-level components will change based on the revision selected and the lower level components are determined based on the effective date.
revision.externalId.name: revision.externalId

revision.internalId.description: For work orders, NetSuite automatically populates the effective revision based on the effective date. If you change the revision selected on the work order, then NetSuite changes the components on the top level assembly based on the revision selected.If you change the revision selected on the work order and the Build Subassembly box is checked, then top-level components will change based on the revision selected and the lower level components are determined based on the effective date.
revision.internalId.name: revision.internalId

revision.name.description: For work orders, NetSuite automatically populates the effective revision based on the effective date. If you change the revision selected on the work order, then NetSuite changes the components on the top level assembly based on the revision selected.If you change the revision selected on the work order and the Build Subassembly box is checked, then top-level components will change based on the revision selected and the lower level components are determined based on the effective date.
revision.name.name: revision.name

schedulingMethod.value.description: Select a Scheduling Method:Forward Scheduling - to set production start date and calculate the time, materials, and resources required to complete all necessary operations to finish the task.Backward Scheduling to set the production end date, which is the date you need to have the completed items. NetSuite calculates the time, materials, and resources required to complete all necessary operations.
schedulingMethod.value.name: schedulingMethod.value

startDate.description: In the Production Start Date field, enter the date you expect to begin assembly production. This field defaults to today's date.    * Demand Planning bases component demand on the production start date.    * Manufacturing Routing production start date depends on whether NetSuite uses forward or backward scheduling to calculate production requirements.To learn more, see Production Scheduling Methods Overview.
startDate.name: startDate

subsidiary.externalId.description: If you use OneWorld, select a subsidiary.
subsidiary.externalId.name: subsidiary.externalId

subsidiary.internalId.description: If you use OneWorld, select a subsidiary.
subsidiary.internalId.name: subsidiary.internalId

subsidiary.name.description: If you use OneWorld, select a subsidiary.
subsidiary.name.name: subsidiary.name

tranDate.description: NetSuite displays today's Date as the default work order date.You can enter or select another date.
tranDate.name: tranDate

tranId.description: NetSuite increases the largest work order number by one.   1. To enter another order number, go to Setup > Company > Setup Tasks > Auto-Generated Numbers.   2. On the Transactions subtab, next to Work Order, check the Allow Override box.   3. Click Save.      The next order number will revert to the standard pattern.
tranId.name: tranId

type.value.description: Select a Customer to associate with this work order.
type.value.name: type.value

units.externalId.description: The Units field displays the units of the component used in the parent assembly.
units.externalId.name: units.externalId

units.internalId.description: The Units field displays the units of the component used in the parent assembly.
units.internalId.name: units.internalId

units.name.description: The Units field displays the units of the component used in the parent assembly.
units.name.name: units.name
